climbs.name: User Friendly (aka Foreplay)
climbs.fa: Rob Lemon and Steve Sangdahl ca. 1981

content.description: Climb the right side of the south face of the tower. A single bolt protects the opening moves, then 2(?) more to the anchors above.
content.protection: Bolts, nuts & cams should you feel the need to supplement to a bolted anchor above.
content.location: South face of the coyote tower.

content.description: Cool problem that rarely sees any action. SDS or SS in the middle of the face on  the crack. Climb over roof on the left side, once your feet are above the roof move right to letter box and top out.
content.location: At the base of the coyote tower, climb the wide face left of the obvious crack.

content.description: 2 bolts protect the low crux with another 2 bolts protecting the high crux which are both about the same grade, although a different style. A balancy few opening moves to a thought-provoking ever so slightly reachy move at the second bolt lead to a slab above. Clip the third bolt and do a power move to gain the small roof with a high step. Climb over the roof on the left for the proper send, or traverse right onto Foreplay to not enjoy the snuggle...Like most sport routes, consider a stick clip if 5.9 is your leading grade.
content.location: Located left of Foreplay on Coyote Tower.  The start is left of the pine tree that splits the face on the ground, on the SW arete of the tower.

climbs.name: Hydroponics- right crack strictly
climbs.fa: Steve Sangdahl and Jack Klein ca. 1981

content.description: Climb the right crack only of the two cracks that make up Hydroponics.  Climb directly up to this crack from underneath avoiding the leftmost start of Hydroponics.  Short but super fun finger crack sequence.  Cool small two tips lock at crux near top.
content.protection: Excellent! Small to mid-sized wires and cams and smallest of the tricam (White,Black, Pink).  Same anchors on top as Hydroponics of course.

content.description: Climb obvious cracks on the river side of the tower. Most people start this from the notch between the tower and main bluff line and traverse into the crack. To add an extra bit of difficulty do the V1 crack that start at the very base of the tower.
content.protection: Plenty of small cams or wires, chain anchors
content.location: On the riverside of the coyote tower.

content.description: Climb slightly overhung side of tower, seems like it could be done a few different ways.
content.location: Road side of the coyote tower.

content.description: 60 foot tower at the right end of Y-Crack Wall. Occasional loose rock on non river side of the rock.
